info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 11:43PM CDT until April 7 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile AL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Baldwin and northwest Florida, including the following county, Escambia.
* WHEN...Until 200 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1141 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Daphne, Fairhope, Robertsdale, Point Clear, Loxley, Silverhill, Rosinton, Gateswood, Belforest, Clay City, Tenile, Barrineau Park, Bay Springs, Montrose and Battles Wharf. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM CDT MONDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
